alert.note: Alert for Greene; Hale; Marengo; Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 03 at 7:50PM CST until February 07 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam affecting Sumter, Marengo, Greene and Hale Counties. .Flooding continues on the Tombigbee River and a flood warning remains in effect. Another statement will be issued by Saturday morning, or sooner if conditions warrant. && ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River At Demopolis Lock and Dam. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 68.0 feet, Flooding of lowlands in the area occurs and cattle should be moved to higher ground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CST Friday the stage was 61.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow evening to a crest of 68.9 feet Sunday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 68.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
